LGBTQ+ Eric Rofes Multicultural Queer Resource Center (ERC) HSU Warren House 53, 1 Harpst St, Arcata, CA 95521 707-826-3795 https://www2.humboldt.edu/erc The ERC’s mission is to shift public opinion of the queer community on campus and in the local area from tolerance to acceptance. The ERC creates a hub for students to learn about events and organizations on campus Humboldt Rainbow Connection P.O. Box 111, Eureka CA 95502 https://www.facebook.com/humboldtpride/ Organizers of the Humboldt Pride Parade and Festival. Provide queer community space and can help direct towards resources. PFLAG, Parents, Families and Friends of Lesbians and Gays https://www.facebook.com/p ﬂ ag.eurekaarcata/ Uniting people who are lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, and queer (LGBTQ) with families, friends, and allies, PFLAG is committed to advancing equality through its mission of support, education, and advocacy. See website for local chapter meeting time/location. Queer Humboldt P.O. Box 45, Arcata, CA 95518-0045 707-502-2890 http://www.queerhumboldt.org/ Queer Humboldt is an organization dedicated to providing resources for the queer community. Website lists local events, groups, links, visitor information, news and pictures that will bene fi t the queer community. Website also provides detailed queer resource list. Gay and Lesbian Medical Association 1326 18th Street NW Suite 22 Washington, DC 20036 202-600-8037 http://www.glma.org/ Maintains a searchable online database of LGBT friendly doctors and care providers and web pages devoted to transgender health resources. Transgender Health Services, Humboldt Open Door Clinic 770 10th Street, Arcata, CA 95521 Sergio Codina at: 707-826-8610, ext. *1139 http://opendoorhealth.com/opendoor/transgender-health-services/ Support group meets every last Wednesday of the month at 5:30pm (age 18+ only). Services include primary and preventive health care, same day appointments, STD screening, hormone therapy, referrals for sex reassignment surgeries and in-house lab draws. The clinics also o ff er case management, behavioral health consults, access to mental health care and a monthly Transgender Support Group. Clinicians follow WPATH standards.
